sentences.sContent: But it is impossible to predict the reaction of a man accosted by another with the words "you rat" without referring to the meaning that the man spoken to attaches to the epithet.
sentences.sContent_eng: But it is impossible to predict the reaction of a man accosted by another with the words "you rat" without referring to the meaning that the man spoken to attaches to the epithet.
sentences.sCn: 但是，当你不带意识地，说出别人的绰号“老鼠”的时候，你还是无法预测这个人会有怎样的反应。

sentences.sContent: My teen years were marked by the common epithet “Camel Jockey” and the hit AM radio song “Ahab the A-rab.”
sentences.sContent_eng: My teen years were marked by the common epithet “Camel Jockey” and the hit AM radio song “Ahab the A-rab.”
sentences.sCn: “骆驼骑师” （Camel Jockey）和调幅电台的热门歌曲“Ahab the A-rab”是我青少年时代人们通用的绰号。

sentences.sContent: For her part, though, Ono found the epithet less than distressing.
sentences.sContent_eng: For her part, though, Ono found the epithet less than distressing.
sentences.sCn: 不过，对于她来说，小野发现这一绰号决不她痛心。

phrases.pCn: 转移修饰语；转类形容词

remMethod.val: epi(在…下) + thet(=put放) → (人)放到下面的话 → (贬低人的)短语或形容词
